IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE FUND'S PRIMARY EXEMPT PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT, PROMOTE, AND FOSTER THE EDUCATIONAL MISSION OF ITS PARENT ORGANIZATION, QUEENS COLLEGE OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE FUND'S PRIMARY EXEMPT PURPOSE IS TO SUPPORT, PROMOTE, AND FOSTER THE EDUCATIONAL MISSION OF ITS PARENT ORGANIZATION, QUEENS COLLEGE OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK.
IRS990.Desc: QUEENS COLLEGE SPECIAL PROJECT FUND'S PRIMARY EXEMPT ACTIVITY IS TO HOLD AND OPERATE A RESIDENCE HALL FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE STUDENT OF THE QUEENS COLLEGE OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK. THE RESIDENCE HALL CONSISTS OF A STUDENT HOUSING FACILITY DESIGNED TO HOUSE 506 STUDENTS, AN 89 CAR PARKING GARAGE, AND OTHER AMENITIES. THE FACILITIES HAVE ALSO BEEN USED TO HOLD CONFERENCES THAT SUPPORT THE EDUCATIONAL MISSION OF QUEENS COLLEGE OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FUND IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE CODE); THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS REFLECTED IN THE COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FUND HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. THE FUND PRESENTLY DISCLOSES OR RECOGNIZES INCOME TAX POSITIONS BASED ON MANAGEMENT'S ESTIMATE OF WHETHER IT IS REASONABLY POSSIBLE OR PROBABLE THAT A LIABILITY HAS BEEN INCURRED FOR UNRECOGNIZED INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT HAS CONCLUDED THAT THE FUND HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT IN ITS COMBINED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. U.S. FORMS 990 FILED BY THE FUND ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: QUEENS COLLEGE SPECIAL PROJECTS, INC. DOES NOT HAVE ITS OWN PAYROLL; QSR IS MANAGED BY A 3RD PARTY, CAPSTONE, THAT USES THEIR TAX ID FOR THE QSR EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 WAS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S FINANCIAL DEPARTMENT. A COPY OF THE DRAFT FORM 990 WAS CIRCULATED TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR DISCUSSION AND COMMENT. EACH BOARD MEMBER WAS PROVIDED AMPLE OPPORTUNITY TO COMMENT ON THE INFORMATION CONTAINED IN THE 990 PRIOR TO ITS FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FUND OPERATES UNDER THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY OF ITS PARENT ORGANIZATION, QUEENS COLLEGE OF CUNY. EACH OFFICER, DIRECTOR, TRUSTEE, AND KEY EMPLOYEE OF THE COLLEGE IS REQUIRED TO ANNUALLY DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THAT ARISE BY VIRTUE OF THEIR EMPLOYMENT, BOARD SERVICE, OR POSITION WITH THE COLLEGE. THE COLLEGE MONITORS COMPLIANCE WITH ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THROUGH AN ANNUAL QUESTIONNAIRE/DISCLOSURE STATEMENT THAT IS DISTRIBUTED TO THESE INDIVIDUALS. POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE INVESTIGATED IMMEDIATELY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS FORM 990 AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC BY RETAINING A COPY AT ITS PLACE OF BUSINESS. THE FORM 990 IS LIKEWISE PUBLISHED ON THE INTERNET AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG. THE ORGANIZATION'S AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY WILL BE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST AND AT MANAGEMENT'S DISCRETION.
NO CHANGES HAVE TAKEN PLACE DURING THE FISCAL YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: QUEENS COLLEGE OF THE CITY UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK
